messages.subject: teen rebellion
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/8/03 12:59:58 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/8/03 12:59:58 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Have we bred rebellion into teen life in an effort to
scuplt who they are and what they value? >>

Yes, I think it's societal. Part of what is viewed as rebellion is simply the
natural pulling away process that teens need to go through. But the actual
rebellious behavior is partly societal messages and hugely the way parents
control.

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
